titleStmt.title: Istanbul, Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi), "Saray Medina 1a" (Gotthelf Bergsträßer archives) [= Karatay 3]

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

availability.p: Image credits: Gotthelf-Bergsträßer-Filmarchiv, Bayerische Akademie der Wissenschaften.

msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 391 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: M. 1; Text: 15-19 lines per page; Dimensions: 240 x 320 mm; Script style: kūfī (six different hads); Estimated date of production: 700-800 [2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries, according to Karatay 1962 see below].

This almost complete codex of the Qurʾān was mentioned for the first time by Gotthelf Bergsträßer in the posthumously third part of the Geschichte des Qorāns (Leipzig 1938) as "Istanbul, Saray, Medina 1a". Bergsträßer also includes an image (Geschichte des Qorāns, table VIII, illustration 10) and mentions dimensions "Format der Seite 32 x 24 cm". According to images in the archives of Gotthelf Bergsträßer, the manuscript contains 308 fol., whereas Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968) lists 391 folios. After this manuscript was in this catalogue since 2012, the entry underlined the importance of this manuscript. In 2020 Tayyar Altıkulaç published a volume with coloured images of 391 folios which we are not allowed to publish in this entry (Mushaf-ı Şerif, Altıkulaç 2020). Interestingly - without giving credit to Bergsträßer's archives - Altıulaç inlcudes Bergsträßer's reference in the title of his edition, most probably inspired by this catalogue. From 87v to 391v we have the black-and-white of Bergsträßer's archives as image no. 1, the coloured images as image no. 2 (for which we don't have the rights of publication. This is why the second image is not shown in this catalogue.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 1-2: "3. M. 1. Aynı Eser. Parşömen. 320 mm. boy ve 240 mm. eninde 391 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi yazı ile 220mm. uzunl. 15-19 satır. Taminen II – III. (VIII-IX) asırlar. Sahife kenarları kaǧıtla tamir görünmüş ve bazı sahifeler kûfi ile sonradan yazılmış ve 24. yapraǧı da nesihle tamamlanmıştır. Miklepli, şemse ve köşelikli kahverengi deri cilt tahta üzerine kaplanmıştır."

This can be translated as follows: "A Codex of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 391 folia of 320 mm height and 240 mm width. The text written in Kufic script [contains] 15-19 lines measuring 220 mm. Probably 2nd and 3rd (8th and 9th) centuries. Folia edges have been repaired with paper, some folia are written later in Kufic script and folio 24 is also completed with naskhī script. The leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and cornerpieces (köşelikli) is covered on wooden [board]." (translation Esra Gözeler and Tuba Karaşahin).
Measurements in the Turkish catalogue, 320 x 240 mm, appear to be the same as in Geschichte des Qorāns.

Die Tintenfarbe ist auf den vorliegenden Schwarz-Weiß-Photographien nur schlecht erkennbar, wahrscheinlich ist sie schwarz oder dunkelbraun. Die Schrift weist durchgehend diakritische Zeichen auf, Vokalzeichen sind in einer helleren Tinte, wahrscheinlich in rot eingetragen. Es handelt sich um eine Handschrift die aus verschiedenen Teilen zusammengesetzt wurde, mindestens vier Schriftstile lassen sich nachweisen.

l.note: Hinter dem T ist ein Punkt auf derselben Zeile zu erkennen
Verstrenner scheint zunächst ausradiert und dann nachgezogen worden zu sein
